the result of shifting each letter in the plaintext 9 positions down the Greek alphabet. For example, the letter π (pi) in the plaintext becomes σ (sigma) in the encoded text, because σ is the 9th letter after π in the Greek alphabet. Similarly, the letter η (eta) in the plaintext becomes ω (omega) in the encoded text, because ω is the 9th letter after η in the Greek alphabet.
(Note: The Greek characters are not encoded as they are, but as their corresponding Unicode code points. The encoded text is in hexadecimal format.)
